teaching.topicContent: Expand on the verb 'to have' by covering its usage in different tenses.
Introduction to adverbs of manner and examine how they describe how an action is performed.
Explore adverbs of time (when) and adverbs of frequency (how often).
Discuss adverbs of degree (how much) and adverbs of place (where) in sentences.
Discuss modal adverbs (e.g., certainly, definitely, probably) that indicate the degree of possibility or certainty expressed by modal verbs.
Introduction phrasal verbs (verbs combined with prepositions or adverbs) and discuss their meanings and usage.
Explain the difference between transitive verbs (require direct objects) and intransitive verbs (do not require direct objects).

teaching.topicTitle: Making Verbs from Nouns and Adjectives
teaching.topicContent: Learn how to form verbs from nouns and adjectives using suffixes.

teaching.topicTitle: Writing Adjectives in the Correct Order
teaching.topicContent: An exercises for students to practice arranging adjectives in the correct order when describing nouns.

teaching.topicTitle: Prepositional Phrases as Adverbs and Adjectives
teaching.topicContent: Reinforcement understanding of prepositional phrases as adverbs.
Learn the usage of semicolons to connect related independent clauses in compound sentences. Discuss the rules and provide examples.
Explore subordinating conjunctions (although, because, since, if, when, etc.) and how they create complex sentences by connecting dependent and independent clauses.

teaching.topicTitle: Verbs, 'To Do': Past, Present, Future, Contractions and Questions and Statements
teaching.topicContent: Cover the verb 'to do' and its usage in different tenses.

teaching.topicTitle: Verbs, 'To be': Past, Present, Future, Contractions and Questions and Statements
teaching.topicContent: Cover the verb 'to be' and its usage in different tenses.
Introduction to modal verbs (can, could, may, might, must, shall, should, will, would) and their functions in expressing possibility, necessity, and more.

test.description: Put your Grammar knowledge to the test.

questions.content: Which sentence correctly uses the present continuous tense?
answers: He is playing video games now.
They will swim in the pool.

questions.content: Identify the correct form of the verb 'to have' in the past perfect tense: They ______ finished their assignments.
Choose the correct irregular past participle for the verb 'go':
What is the proper use of the semicolon in the sentences
answers: She loves reading; books are her favorite.
She loves reading; because books are her favorite.
She loves reading, books are her favorite.
She loves reading. Books are her favorite.

questions.content: Choose the sentence with the correct use of a transitive verb:

Identify the correct order of adjectives to describe the noun 'house':

What is the correct form of the verb 'to be' for the pronoun 'he' in the present perfect tense?

What is the function of the word 'when' in the sentence: 'She reads when she has free time.'
Choose the sentence that correctly uses a colon:
answers: I have three favorite colors: blue, green, and purple.
He is running: fast and gracefully.
She wrote a letter; and he read it.

questions.content: Identify the adverbial clause in the sentence: 'While I was sleeping, the storm arrived.'
Which of the following sentences uses the past perfect continuous tense correctly?
answers: She is baking a cake for two hours.
They had been studying all night.
I am writing a letter now.

questions.content: Identify the sentence that correctly uses the present perfect continuous tense:
answers: She has been reading that book since yesterday.
They will been practicing for the performance.
I had been painting the wall.

Identify the adverbial phrase in the sentence: 'After finishing his meal, he went for a walk.'
Which sentence correctly uses an adverbial clause of time?
answers: When the sun sets, the stars appear.

Identify the modal verb in the sentence: 'You should eat your vegetables.'
Choose the sentence with the correct use of a modal adverb:
answers: He can perhaps finish the project.
Certainly he can finish the project.
He can finish perhaps the project.
He perhaps can finish the project.

answers: She is baking a cake for two hours.
They have been studying all night.

answers: She might possibly join us later.
Certainly, she might join us later.
She might join us definitely later.

answers: He will went to the park.

answers: He shall go to the park yesterday.
You shall read a book tomorrow.

They shall visit their grandparents next week.

answers: He cooked dinner in a hurry.

answers: Could you please pass the salt?

answers: The book that I read was amazing.

answers: They might danced at the party.
I will finish my homework soon.

answers: I mays go to the park?
